creator: starlight@binnacle.cx
text:
'make install' fails for httpd 2.3 under CentOS 4.4 Linux.
Works fine on Solars 8.  Had to fall back to httpd 2.2 on
the Linux machine.

creator: rpluem@apache.org
text:
Please provide an description of what is actually failing during make install.
Please consider also that 2.3 is trunk. Not every revision on trunk actually
builds or installs properly. So please provide the revision number of your svn
checkout that failed.

Created attachment 19052
Upload contains output files from build and failed install.

Goofed on the version.	It's 2.2.3.
Did indeed work ok on Solaris 8.
Successfuly fallback was to 2.2.2 for CentOS 4.4.

Upload contains output files from build and failed install.
Renamed existing /usr/local/apache2 to .hold before attempt.
creator: starlight@binnacle.cx

text:
You should be able to fix this by passing --with-included-apr to configure, can
you try that?

The change to prevent httpd using the APR install from the previous httpd
install is missing on the APR branches; will backport.
creator: jorton@redhat.com
starlight@binnacle.cx
text:
Building with '--with-included-apr' in the configuration
solved the problem.  What does it do?  I see no mention of
it in the INSTALL or README file and 2.2.2 does not need
it.  Will I have to do this for future releases or will
the need be eliminated?

Thanks.  The problem was that httpd was picking up the APR library from the
previous httpd installation, which is somewhat doomed to failure.

The fix for this is merged for future APR 1.2.x releases, and hence a future
httpd 2.2.x release which bundles such a future APR 1.2.x release will have this
fixed.

http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=rev&rev=469503
creator: jorton@redhat.com
